intro: Massangea, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Bignoniaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly Mexico and parts of the Caribbean. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange-red. Massangea species often have compound leaves and produce fruit that is a capsule containing seeds. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
